version_description:
Let us know what's important to you! Use the new Feedback button on the More tab (iPhone only) to share your ideas, and to up-vote other users' ideas.

More enhancements to Chart Trading and other improvements:
- See your trade's PL on the chart (at the top of the screen)
- Close trades directly from the chart by tapping the 'X'. You will be prompted to confirm even if confirmations are disabled.
- You will be prompted to confirm when reducing or reversing a position
- Other bug fixes

Note: You can now disable order expiry notifications in More > Settings

Let us know what's important to you! Use the new Feedback button on the More tab (iPhone only) to share your ideas, and to up-vote other users' ideas.

More enhancements to Chart Trading and other improvements:
- See your trade's PL on the chart (at the top of the screen)
- Close trades directly from the chart by tapping the 'X'. You will be prompted to confirm even if confirmations are disabled.
- You will be prompted to confirm when reducing or reversing a position
- Other bug fixes

Note: You can now disable order expiry notifications in More > Settings

Let us know what's important to you! Use the new Feedback button on the More tab (iPhone only) to share your ideas, and to up-vote other users' ideas.

More enhancements to Chart Trading and other improvements:
- See your trade's PL on the chart (at the top of the screen)
- Close trades directly from the chart by tapping the 'X'. You will be prompted to confirm even if confirmations are disabled.
- You will be prompted to confirm when reducing or reversing a position
- Other bug fixes

Note: You can now disable order expiry notifications in More > Settings

• Get notified when a target price is reached in your V20 accounts. Add a Horizontal Line, or Vector Drawing Tool to a chart, then tap the new Price Signal icon to be notified when the price crosses your Drawing Tool.
• Better control over OANDA Alerts. Optionally request only highlights for any category, cutting down the number of alerts you receive.
• iOS 11 beta is now supported!
• Bug fixes and other improvements.

• Get notified when a target price is reached in your V20 accounts. Add a Horizontal Line, or Vector Drawing Tool to a chart, then tap the new Price Signal icon to be notified when the price crosses your Drawing Tool.
• Better control over OANDA Alerts. Optionally request only highlights for any category, cutting down the number of alerts you receive.
• iOS 11 beta is now supported!
• Bug fixes and other improvements.

• iOS 11 beta is now supported!
• Bug fixes and other improvements.
• Use the Order Book overlay to visualize how our users are trading on the legacy platforms. This is only available for fxTrade users and for popular currency pairs.

If you are in Europe, please read on. If you're in any other location, you can safely ignore this update.

If you are a European customer, we will be migrating your legacy trade account(s) to a new V20 account(s) on either 1 December 2017 or 8 December 2017. This will enable OANDA to ensure that your account(s) meet the anticipated regulatory requirements at the beginning of 2018 so you can continue to trade.

Please update the app before 1 December 2017 to avoid having your rates list reset to the default list.

If your account requires you to review your user agreement or update your personal information to continue trading, the app will redirect you to the website so you can take action.

We added a new Trading Performance tool to your live V20 trading accounts. It provides trading history and professional grade metrics to help visualize, track and manage your trading habits. You can find it in the "More" tab (not yet available on iPad).

- Light / Dark Mode! Now you can adjust the theme of the app to suite your environment for a more comfortable experience (or because you like the look of one over the other!) Light mode is quickly becoming our favourite. You can find it in More > Settings > Light Mode.
- Now you can trade directly from the OANDA Alerts tab. Just tap on an alert, and if there's a corresponding instrument, we'll show the chart so you can trade.
- Half Spread Cost in the Portfolio Activity tab is expanded to four decimal places.

- Light / Dark Mode! Now you can adjust the theme of the app to suite your environment for a more comfortable experience (or because you like the look of one over the other!) Light mode is quickly becoming our favourite. You can find it in More > Settings > Light Mode.

- Half Spread Cost in the Portfolio Activity tab is expanded to four decimal places.

- Half Spread Cost in the Portfolio Activity tab is expanded to four decimal places.

- For legacy accounts, there's now a link to the Full Transaction History in the Activity view to see a transaction's Half Spread Cost.

New Feature: SMA Price Signals.
You can now configure a Simple Moving Average to send you a push notification when it crosses the current price. Go to More > Price Signals > SMA.
Your Price Alerts are in the same place, and co-exist with the new SMA Price Signals. Instead of tapping the "+" button to create a Price Alert, tap the "Price" button.

This release contains a few small changes to the rates screen:
- You can now see what markets are closed (greyed out with a clock icon)
- You can see the daily change in pips

We've also fixed a number of bugs.

- Now you can search for instruments in the rates list.
- Instruments are now organized by type, making it easier to find your favorite pairs and add them to your favorites list.

Partial close! You can now partially close any of your open trades. Just tap the reduce button on any open trade and specify how many units to partially close it by. (U.S. customers must still follow the FIFO rules).
We also fixed some bugs to improve your app experience.
We always welcome your feedback, so please reach out to us with any comments, concerns, and suggestions.

- For regions with Guaranteed Stops, we've made normal Stop Losses the default for new installs.
- We've given your transaction history a fresh new look. Head over to Portfolio > Activity to check it out and let us know what you think.

This release contains a number of improvements:
- You can now sign in with your email. Your username will continue to work as well, but we will be requiring email for login in the future. If you have multiple usernames associated with the same email, you'll need to continue signing in with username for now.
- For users testing our new Market Order window, you can now change instruments directly.
- This release contains a number of bug fixes.

As always, we welcome your feedback, so please reach out to us with any suggestions, concerns, and comments.
